newsitem.title: USA: Banc One shareholders approve acq.
newsitem.headline: Banc One shareholders approve acq.

text.p: Shareholders of Banc One Corp. Thursday approved the company's planned $7 billion acquisition of First USA Inc., which would form the nation's third-largest credit card operation.

A Banc One spokesman said shareholders also approved boosting the company's authorised common stock by 350 million shares to 900 million shares. The increase in shares is primarily to complete the stock acquisition, which was announced on Jan. 20.
First USA shareholdes are scheduled to vote on the transaction at a meeting Friday in Dallas.
An activist group called Inner City Press/Community on the Move has filed a lawsuit in a federal appeals court in Washington D.C. seeking to block the merger.
The group, which is seeking to vacate the Federal Reserve Board's approval of the merger, alleges that Banc One companies discriminated in lending and regulators did not take appropriate action.
